intro: Corchorus sidoides subsp. sidoides, commonly known as the African sida, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, ovate leaves, and small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. This species is also noted for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
